subject: RE: [junit] junit structure
msgSnippet: The best way I ve found to determine the structure of a system is to sit down with a debugger or a profiler and watch/trace exactly what happens when you use
messageBody:
The best way I've found to determine the structure of a system is to sit
down with a debugger or a profiler and watch/trace exactly what happens when
you use some part of the system. It is tedious but there is no substitute
for seeing the gears turn.

It seems like you are looking for detailed information on JUnit's
implementation. Is there a particular goal driving this, such as extending
the framework? If so, please share with us because many of us have
experience with this and can assist, given specific requirements.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The object testing company
http://www.javatesting.com
